source.description: Can be used to fetch options through API.

selectFirst.description: Select the first option value by default.

initFetchOn.description: Use expression to configure whether the source interface should fetch initially

initFetch.description: Configure whether the source interface should fetch initially.

joinValues.description: Single-select mode: When user selects an option, the value in the option will be submitted as the form item value, otherwise the entire option object will be submitted as the form item value. Multi-select mode: The `value` of multiple selected options will be connected through `delimiter`, otherwise the values will be submitted directly in array form.

valuesNoWrap.description: Multi-select mode, whether to avoid line wrapping when there are too many values

extractValue.description: When enabled, the selected option value will be wrapped as an array and used as the current form item value.

resetValue.description: When clicking the clear button, set the form item to the currently configured value.

deferApi.description: Delayed loading API. When there are options with defer: true in the options, clicking will expand through this interface.

addControls.description: Form items for adding new entries.

addDialog.description: Control settings for new addition dialog

creatable.description: Whether new items can be added

labelWidth.description: Label custom width, default unit is px

name.description: Field name, key when form is submitted, supports multi-level, connected with dots, e.g.: a.b.c

extraName.description: Additional field name, can be used to flatten another value when it's a range component

submitOnChange.description: Whether to submit the form when modification is complete.

validateOnChange.description: When not set, each modification of form items will trigger re-validation after form submission. If set, this configuration item determines whether to trigger validation on each modification.

mode.description: Configure current form item display mode

horizontal.description: When configured as horizontal layout, used to configure specific left-right allocation.

inline.description: Whether form control is in inline mode.

isEmail.description: Whether it is an email address

isFloat.description: Whether it is a float type

isInt.description: Whether it is an integer type

isUrl.description: Whether it is a URL address

isDateTimeSame.description: Same as target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeBefore.description: Earlier than target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeAfter.description: Later than target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeSameOrBefore.description: Earlier than target date or same as target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeSameOrAfter.description: Later than target date or same as target date, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isDateTimeBetween.description: Date is within target date range, supports specified granularity and interval open/closed forms, defaults to milliseconds, open interval on both sides

isTimeSame.description: Same as target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeBefore.description: Earlier than target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeAfter.description: Later than target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeSameOrBefore.description: Earlier than target time or same as target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeSameOrAfter.description: Later than target time or same as target time, supports specified granularity, defaults to milliseconds

isTimeBetween.description: Time is within target time range, supports specified granularity and interval open/closed forms, defaults to milliseconds, open interval on both sides

value.description: Default value, remember it can only be a static value, does not support variables, data association is achieved by setting the name attribute.

clearValueOnHidden.description: When form item is hidden, whether to delete the form item value from current Form. Note that values of unhidden form items with the same name will also be deleted

validateApi.description: Remote validation interface for form items

showSuggestion.description: Whether it is reference input mode, reference input will display candidate values for user selection instead of direct filling.

defaultSelection.description: Default selected value in reference input mode

silent.description: Whether to display data format error prompts, the default is not to display

mode.description: Pop-up window mode, configurable when entering for reference

position.description: When the reference is entered as a drawer, the pop-up position can be configured

size.description: Configurable size of popup container when typing for reference

columns.description: Refer to the entry displayed items

filter.description: Refer to the filter conditions when entering

autoFill.description: Autofill, when an option is selected, synchronously sets the other values in the option into the form.

$$id.description: The unique id of the component, mainly used to locate json nodes in the page designer

$ref.description: Used together with definitions, an infinite loop renderer can be implemented.

id.description: The unique id of the component, mainly used for log collection

staticPlaceholder.description: Static display of empty value placeholder

staticClassName.description: Static display form item class name

staticLabelClassName.description: Static display of form item Label class name

staticInputClassName.description: Static display of form item Value class name

behavior.description: Component behavior and usage, such as create, update, remove

displayName.description: Component name, usually the business name for easy location

mock.description: Editor fake data for easy display

editorSetting.description: Editor configuration, can be ignored at runtime

useMobileUI.description: Can be used to turn off mobile style at the component level

remark.description: Display a small icon and display prompt content when the mouse is placed on it

labelRemark.description: Display a small icon. When the mouse is placed on it, the prompt content is displayed. This small icon is together with the label.

$$id.description: The unique id of the component, mainly used to locate json nodes in the page designer

$ref.description: Used together with definitions, an infinite loop renderer can be implemented.

id.description: Mainly used to distinguish which button is used in user behavior tracking

staticPlaceholder.description: Static display of empty value placeholder

staticClassName.description: Static display form item class name

staticLabelClassName.description: Static display of form item Label class name

staticInputClassName.description: Static display of form item Value class name

behavior.description: Component behavior and usage, such as create, update, remove

displayName.description: Component name, usually the business name for easy location

mock.description: Editor fake data for easy display

editorSetting.description: Editor configuration, can be ignored at runtime

useMobileUI.description: Can be used to turn off mobile style at the component level

type.description: Specify the button type, supporting three types: button, submit or reset.

block.description: Whether to display in block format, the default is inline.

rightIcon.description: Right button icon, class name of iconfont

rightIconClassName.description: css class name on the right icon

confirmText.description: Prompt text, configured to require user confirmation before operation.

required.description: If the button is in a form, configuring this attribute will require the user to pass verification of the specified field before triggering the behavior.

close.description: If the button is in a pop-up box, you can configure whether to close the pop-up window after the action is completed, or specify to close the target pop-up box.

requireSelected.description: When the button is a batch operation button, there must be a checked element by default to be clickable. If this attribute is configured to false, the member can be clicked without clicking.

mergeData.description: Whether to merge the data in the pop-up box into the parent scope.

target.description: You can specify who should trigger this action.

loadingOn.description: Whether to display the loading effect

actionType.description: Specifies the behavior for sending ajax.

isolateScope.description: Whether to enable request isolation, mainly used to isolate requests for linkage CRUD and Service

autoComplete.description: Auto-complete API. When entering partial text, this text can be retrieved through  and sent to the interface. The interface can return matching options to help user input.

nativeAutoComplete.description: Configure the autoComplete attribute of native input

borderMode.description: Border mode, full border, half border, or no border.

minLength.description: Limit the minimum number of text inputs

maxLength.description: Limit the maximum number of text inputs

lowerCase.description: Characters entered by the user are automatically converted to lowercase

upperCase.description: Characters entered by the user are automatically converted to uppercase

inputControlClassName.description: CSS class name of control node

nativeInputClassName.description: CSS class name of native input tag

clearValueOnEmpty.description: Clear value when content is empty
